thread.title: Fans torment James Dolan as Knicks fall to Nuggets
thread.title_full: Fans torment James Dolan as Knicks fall to Nuggets

author: DANIEL POPPER
title: Fans torment James Dolan as Knicks fall to Nuggets

organizations.name: nuggets fans torment james dolan as knicks

text:
Fans torment James Dolan as Knicks fall to 11 games under .500 with embarrassing loss to Nuggets Fans torment James Dolan as Knicks fall to Nuggets The Knicks, once again, failed to defend. (Mary Altaffer/AP)   9:47 PM 
Jim Dolan banned Charles Oakley from the Garden. 
In reality, forcing him to watch every remaining minute in this Knicks season would be a worse punishment. 
Surrounded by Oakley chants and an increasingly frustrated fan base, the Knicks lost again Friday night, 131-123 to the Nuggets. It's their fourth straight defeat. They've dropped 23 of their last 31 games to plummet out of the playoff picture. 
Carmelo Anthony scored 19 of his 31 points in the fourth quarter to keep the game competitive down the stretch. But the effort was too late. 
The game was more of the same for Dolan's team. The Knicks failed to defend. They let up 121 points to the miserable Lakers on Sunday before surrendering 119 to the Clippers on Wednesday. The 131 points the Nuggets scored are the most the Knicks have allowed in regulation this season. 
The effort just isn't consistent enough to produce winning basketball. Early in the third quarter, Kristaps Porzingis turned the ball over on an out of bounds pass. The Knicks then didn't account for Nuggets guard Gary Harris, and he slipped behind his sleepwalking opponents. 
Nuggets center Nikola Jokic, who dropped a game-high 40 points, collected the ball behind the sideline and delivered a floating pass. Harris dunked the ball home without any pressure, as the Garden crowd groined in utter disappointment. 
It's the type of play that never happened under Oakley's watch. It's also the type of play that epitomizes the Knicks in 2017. Tags:
